segments.text: I see the woman, her dress flowing as she moves, yet oblivious to the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost infuriating how she doesn’t notice the water soaking into the cabinets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool has his hand deep inside that cookie jar, his face full of mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe he's going for it, so close to spilling and ruining everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to yell at him to stop, but I also admire his courage.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s anticipation is palpable; the way she watches him is almost theatrical.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the mess that will follow if he slips and falls—oh, the chaos!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why doesn’t the woman see what’s happening? It’s driving me mad!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen should be a quiet place, but it feels like a stage for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me wonder whether this ordinary moment will end in laughter or tears.
segments.speaker: PAR
